results.title: Here are the companies that will cover travel expenses for employee abortions.

results.title: States Rush to Revamp Laws After Supreme Court’s Gun Ruling
results.abstract: After some restrictions on gun permits were deemed unconstitutional, legislators announced plans to craft new laws that honor the ruling while still creating limits.

results.title: Their Baby Died. Then a Boston Hospital Lost the Body.
results.abstract: Everleigh McCarthy was less than 2 weeks old when she died at Brigham and Women’s Hospital in 2020. The police said her remains were “probably mistaken as soiled linen” and discarded.

media.caption: Daniel McCarthy and Alana Ross had gone through two miscarriages when they learned she was pregnant with Everleigh in February 2020. The couple have filed a lawsuit against Brigham and Women’s Hospital.
media.copyright: Vanessa Leroy for The New York Times

results.title: She Fainted During the World Championships. Her Coach Came to the Rescue.
results.abstract: Anita Alvarez, an American artistic swimmer, lost consciousness while performing her solo routine in Budapest. She was “fine” afterward, her coach said.

results.title: F.B.I. Raids Orlando Museum and Removes Basquiat Paintings
results.abstract: All 25 works in the museum’s Jean-Michel Basquiat exhibition were seized by the F.B.I. An affidavit called into question their origin and their authenticity.

results.title: ‘My Aching Heart Is Shattered Into Little Pieces’
